title: Oh What Fun
venue: Mesa Arts Center - 1 E Main St, Mesa, AZ 85201: Mesa, AZ

title: Sing, Sing, Sing
venue: Mesa Arts Center - 1 E Main St, Mesa, AZ 85201: Mesa, AZ

title: Brass Harmony
venue: St. Barnabas on the Desert - 6715 N Mockingbird Ln, Paradise Valley, AZ 85253: Paradise Valley
description: Join us at Saint Barnabas as we embark on a musical journey like no other while inaugurating your Salt River Brass’ 44th season.  Under the inspired baton of our world-class Music Director, Julie Desbordes, this concert promises an afternoon of brass brilliance.  As Saint Barnabas on the Desert opens its doors to us, you'll be welcomed into a sacred space that perfectly complements the resonant and immersive tones of brass. The collaboration with the stellar organist Michael Salazar adds an extra layer of richness to your experience.  The program promises a diverse selection, ranging from classical masterpieces (including Bach and Strauss) to modern exciting compositions (John Williams), all brought to life through the exceptional artistry of the SRB musicians.  Whether you're a seasoned brass enthusiast or a newcomer to the genre, "Brass Harmony" guarantees an unforgettable experience!

title: Legends
venue: Mesa Arts Center - 1 E Main St, Mesa, AZ 85201: Mesa, AZ
description: On November 10, 2024, join us at the beautiful Ikeda Theater at the Mesa Arts Center for a musical salute to the heroes who have served our nation with focused dedication as we present "Legends," a special concert dedicated to Veterans Day.  We are honored to welcome back to the state “The President’s Own” Marine Band guest euphonium soloist Gunnery Sergeant Hiram Diaz, with his unparalleled skillset and contagious passion.  "Legends" will not only showcase the exceptional talents of the SRB but will also pay homage to the legendary men and women who have served in our Armed Forces. The program will feature iconic pieces that echo the valor and sacrifice of our veterans, creating a musical tapestry that tells their stories.  Together, let us salute the legends who have shaped our history and continue to inspire us all!

title: Winter Wonderland
venue: Mesa Arts Center - 1 E Main St, Mesa, AZ 85201: Mesa, AZ
description: At the Ikeda Theater, let the spirit of the season come alive as we present "Winter Wonderland," a magical brass band concert in collaboration with the Phoenix Children’s Chorus! Join us for a heartwarming celebration that brings together the enchanting sounds of brass and the angelic voices of the young choristers.  Together, we invite you to experience the joy, wonder, and beauty of the holidays through a captivating musical journey. From timeless carols to contemporary holiday favorites, our combined forces will create a symphony of sound that captures the essence of the season.  Secure your tickets early for this enchanting musical collaboration, where "Winter Wonderland" becomes a reality through the combined talents of brass and voices, uniting generations in the joy of the holidays.

title: We’ve Got Rhythm
venue: Mesa Arts Center - 1 E Main St, Mesa, AZ 85201: Mesa, AZ
description: Immerse yourself in infectious beats and smooth melodies at the Ikeda Theater as we bring you "We’ve Got Rhythm," a SRB concert that swings to the soulful tunes of jazz.  As the lights dim and the stage comes alive, we’ll transport you to the golden era of jazz. From classic standards to contemporary interpretations, "We’ve Got Rhythm" promises a musical journey that celebrates the diversity and vitality of jazz. Whether you're a jazz aficionado or a newcomer to the genre, this performance guarantees an afternoon of excitement and the kind of musical magic that only a brass band can deliver. Secure your tickets for the concert where SRB unashamedly proves that indeed, "We’ve Got Rhythm.”

title: Love Poems
venue: Lutheran Church - 19200 N. Del Webb blvd, Sun City, 85373: Sun City
description: Spring calls for a celebration! Join us at the Lutheran Church of Sun City for an afternoon that promises to be a musical love letter to the heart and soul.  With the return of the enchanting singer, Carol FitzPatrick, this special event also features an exciting collaboration with the Salt River Youth Brass Band and the talent of young musicians in the Valley. The collaboration with the youth brass band brings a fresh perspective and energy to the stage, showcasing the talent and passion of the next generation of musicians. The return of beloved soprano Carol Fitzpatrick adds an extra layer of magic to the afternoon. Her enchanting voice will create an atmosphere that is both intimate and grand. "Love Poems" invites you to immerse yourself in a symphony of emotions, where the notes of brass and the lyrics of love blend in perfect harmony.

title: The Big Brass Theory
venue: St. Barnabas on the Desert - 6715 N Mockingbird Ln, Paradise Valley, AZ 85253: Paradise Valley
description: Join us as we kick off our 45th Anniversary season celebrating the rich and vibrant world of brass music! Under the baton of SRB’s inspiring Music Director, Julie Desbordes, we are thrilled to return for the third time to the stunning Saint Barnabas on the Desert, collaborating once again with its exceptional organist: Michael Salazar.  This captivating program features timeless masterworks from Johan Sebastian Bach, Georg Friedrich Handel, Claudio Monteverdi alongside exuberant creations by Sandy Smith and Philip Sparke. We look forward to seeing you at this unforgettable event of brass brilliance and mastery!

title: Heroic Sounds
venue: Mesa Arts Center - 1 E Main St, Mesa, AZ 85201: Mesa, AZ
description: Together we honor our Nation’s heroes in SRB’s annual heartfelt musical tribute to Veterans. Let us unite in appreciation of the many men and women who served or are serving in our Armed Forces. The pieces will vary in brilliance, featuring beautifully singing melodies from soloists from our group as well as brilliant marches and heroic pieces for full brass band, and all of our favorite patriotic music. Together, let’s honor our heroes. For more information about our season at the Mesa Arts Center, please check it out

title: Making Spirits Bright
venue: Mesa Arts Center - 1 E Main St, Mesa, AZ 85201: Mesa, AZ
description: Make our magical concert event part of your Holiday tradition! Join us for an unforgettable concert of joy and wonder as the Salt River Brass presents its third collaboration with the exceptional Phoenix Children Chorus. The PCC’s voices blending with the rich and warm tone of SRB’s brass instruments are a perfect combination for the holiday season. Our family-friendly event will satisfy audiences of all ages, featuring a variety of holiday classics and culminating in a breathtaking finale with both ensembles united on stage.  Celebrate the holidays in style—with music that will fill our hearts. Save the date and make your holiday season truly special!

title: Brass Cats
venue: Mesa Arts Center - 1 E Main St, Mesa, AZ 85201: Mesa, AZ
description: The Salt River Brass presents an unforgettable evening of jazz standards! Vocalist Nathan DeShon Myers returns as you immerse yourself in the timeless sounds of various jazz genres and let the music move you. Secure your tickets now and experience the magic of live jazz!

title: Inspiration
venue: Mesa Arts Center - 1 E Main St, Mesa, AZ 85201: Mesa, AZ
description: Join the Salt River Brass for a Celebration of Youth and Inspiration. Experience the joy of music and the power of growth at this special concert event. Arizona’s Premier Brass Band is exciting to offer you a concert full of collaborations.Opening the event, the Salt River Youth Brass Band is showcasing their talent and remarkable progress through an inspiring selection of pieces. Following this, the Salt River Brass will take the stage with a vibrant and energetic program guaranteed to captivate audiences.In the second half, we are thrilled to welcome once again our colleague Master Sergeant (MSG) Kevin Geboin an unforgettable set of spectacular pieces. Lastly, a united stage with all musicians performing “Stars and Stripes Forever” will deliver an emotional and celebratory finale, showcasing the talent and spirit of all ensembles, and is guaranteed to leave a lasting impression.
